Body: I have a gooapple 5. After I did a factory reset it says invalid IMEI. I followed the solution from here:How to fix "Invalid IMEI " after Factory reset? but no luck because:I did the factory reset before I saved the original modem.img (I didn't know I had to do it)When I go to the data folder there are NO files whatsoever at all. It is just an empty folder named data. This extension nvram/md/NVRAM/NVD_IMEI/MP0B_001 is not there! I am using the z4root and rootexplorer to access the files.Please can someone help with detailed instructions on how to fix this problem?
Title: IMEI invalid after applying factory reset on gooapple 5

history.Text: As the titles says I have a gooapple 5 (http://www.fastcardtech.com/goods-6383-GooApple+5+35+inch+capacitive+screen+50M+camera+MTK+6516+Android+23windows+dual+os+wifi+GPS+AGPS+Dual.html) which after i did a factory reset it says invalid IMEI. I followed the solution from here http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/8570/how-to-fix-invalid-imei-after-factory-reset but no luck because:1. I did the factory reset before i saved the original modem.img (i didnt know i had to do it)2. when i go to the data folder there are NO files whatsoever at all. It is just an empty folder named data. This extension nvram/md/NVRAM/NVD_IMEI/MP0B_001 is not there!I am using the z4root and rootexplorer to access the files.Please can someone help with detailed instructions on how to fix this problem?Thank you in advance
IMEI invalid after applying factory reset on gooapple 5

I have a [gooapple 5](http://www.fastcardtech.com/goods-6383-GooApple+5+35+inch+capacitive+screen+50M+camera+MTK+6516+Android+23windows+dual+os+wifi+GPS+AGPS+Dual.html). After I did a factory reset it says invalid IMEI. I followed the solution from here:- http://Android.stackexchange.com/questions/8570/how-to-fix-invalid-imei-after-factory-reset but no luck because:1. I did the factory reset before I saved the original modem.img (I didn't know I had to do it)2. When I go to the data folder there are NO files whatsoever at all. It is just an empty folder named data. This extension `nvram/md/NVRAM/NVD_IMEI/MP0B_001` is not there! I am using the z4root and rootexplorer to access the files.Please can someone help with detailed instructions on how to fix this problem?
